removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant. The cast (double*)A is already a complete expression; an extra surrounding pair can be removed without changing meaning.
Same as line 149: the outer parentheses around the cast are redundant in the function call.
Same as line 149: unnecessary extra parentheses around the cast passed to print_array.

The outermost parentheses wrapping the cast expression are redundant. Keep the required cast parentheses but remove the extra outer pair. (Note: you could also simply free(A) since A is already uint8_t*, but here we only remove redundant parentheses.)

The outer pair surrounding the whole RHS and extra pairs around the cast results are redundant. Keep the necessary parentheses around the sum operands for casts (i + 1, j + 1) but remove the extra grouping parentheses and unnecessary parentheses around the cast operand n. Operator precedence (multiplication/division left-to-right) preserves behavior.
Parentheses are redundant here. Writing num + factor - 1 as the numerator is equivalent and clearer; precedence and associativity produce the same result when dividing by factor.
Parentheses around the array index expression are unnecessary; A[i * n + k] is equivalent and more idiomatic.

removals.replacement: A[i * n + k] / A[k * n + k]
removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the division and the parentheses around the index expressions are redundant. Removing them keeps the same semantics while improving readability.
Parentheses around the array index are unnecessary; A[i * n + j] is equivalent and clearer.
The parentheses around the simple subtraction in the for-condition are unnecessary; i < n - 1 has the intended precedence and is more concise.
Parentheses around the whole first argument are redundant; the comma in the call already separates arguments. The subexpression n - iter + 1 is clear without the extra parentheses.
Same as line 238: parentheses around the argument expression are unnecessary.
Same as line 238: remove redundant parentheses around the first argument expression.
